introduction: Rob and Sam talk about the recipe translators, who help to make the recipes of famous chefs accessib

vocabulary.definition: boiled for too long, resulting in being cooked excessively
vocabulary.example: The overboiled vegetables were mushy and lacked flavor.

vocabulary.definition: a person who translates written text from one language to another
vocabulary.example: She works as a translator, converting English recipes into French.

vocabulary.definition: the act of concentrating on and becoming an expert in a particular subject or skill
vocabulary.example: After years of study, she achieved a specialisation in neuroscience.

vocabulary.definition: to duplicate or reproduce something exactly
vocabulary.example: The chef was able to replicate the intricate dessert from the recipe.

vocabulary.definition: a choice or option that can be used instead of something else
vocabulary.example: If you're out of milk, coconut milk can be a good alternative in baking.

vocabulary.definition: to imitate or copy the actions, speech, or appearance of someone or something
vocabulary.example: The parrot could mimic human speech patterns perfectly.
